when_to_say: Used to greet someone during the day.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、助かりました！ (arigatou, tasukarimashita!) - Thank you, it helped!

when_to_say: Used to bid farewell.
example: さようなら、また明日。 (sayounara, mata ashita) - Goodbye, see you tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to agree or confirm.
example: はい、それは正しいです。 (hai, sore wa tadashii desu) - Yes, that is correct.

when_to_say: Used to disagree or decline.
example: いいえ、それは違います。 (iie, sore wa chigaimasu) - No, that is incorrect.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a building where people live.
example: 私の家は大きいです。 (watashi no ie wa ookii desu) - My house is big.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a book or volume.
example: 彼は本を読んでいます。 (kare wa hon o yondeimasu) - He is reading a book.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a dog.
example: その犬はかわいいです。 (sono inu wa kawaii desu) - That dog is cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cat.
example: 猫は静かです。 (neko wa shizuka desu) - The cat is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an educational institution.
example: 私の学校は近いです。 (watashi no gakkou wa chikai desu) - My school is nearby.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend or companion.
example: 彼は私の友達です。 (kare wa watashi no tomodachi desu) - He is my friend.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a job or task.
example: 私は仕事をしています。 (watashi wa shigoto o shiteimasu) - I am working.

when_to_say: Used to refer to family members.
example: 私の家族は4人です。 (watashi no kazoku wa yonin desu) - My family has four members.

when_to_say: Used to refer to time or hours.
example: 時間がありません。 (jikan ga arimasen) - I don't have time.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an instructor or teacher.
example: 彼女は英語の先生です。 (kanojo wa eigo no sensei desu) - She is an English teacher.

when_to_say: Used to describe something with a small size.
example: この箱はとても小さいです。 (kono hako wa totemo chiisai desu) - This box is very small.

when_to_say: Used to describe something with a high price.
example: その服はとても高いです。 (sono fuku wa totemo takai desu) - That clothing is very expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe something inexpensive.
example: この店の商品は安いです。 (kono mise no shouhin wa yasui desu) - The items in this shop are cheap.

when_to_say: Used to describe something engaging or amusing.
example: この本はとても面白いです。 (kono hon wa totemo omoshiroi desu) - This book is very interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: この景色は美しいです。 (kono keshiki wa utsukushii desu) - This view is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used when purchasing something.
example: 本を買います。 (hon o kaimasu) - I will buy a book.

when_to_say: Used when writing something.
example: 手紙を書きます。 (tegami o kakimasu) - I will write a letter.

when_to_say: Used when reading something.
example: 雑誌を読みます。 (zasshi o yomimasu) - I read a magazine.

when_to_say: Used to describe getting on a vehicle or ride.
example: 電車に乗ります。 (densha ni norimasu) - I get on the train.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of standing.
example: 彼は立っています。 (kare wa tatteimasu) - He is standing.

when_to_say: Used to describe something happening before expected time.
example: 今日は早く起きました。 (kyou wa hayaku okimashita) - I woke up early today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something occurring later than expected.
example: 彼は遅く帰りました。 (kare wa osoku kaerimashita) - He came home late.

when_to_say: Used to describe something recently made or introduced.
example: 新しい靴を買いました。 (atarashii kutsu o kaimashita) - I bought new shoes.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old or outdated.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe a quiet place or environment.
example: その部屋は静かです。 (sono heya wa shizuka desu) - The room is quiet.

when_to_say: Used when describing running or moving quickly.
example: 彼は毎朝走ります。 (kare wa mai asa hashirimasu) - He runs every morning.

when_to_say: Used when describing swimming or moving in water.
example: 彼女はプールで泳ぎます。 (kanojo wa puuru de oyogimasu) - She swims in the pool.

when_to_say: Used when referring to studying or academic work.
example: 私は日本語を勉強しています。 (watashi wa nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu) - I am studying Japanese.

when_to_say: Used when describing the act of eating.
example: 彼はりんごを食べます。 (kare wa ringo o tabemasu) - He eats an apple.

when_to_say: Used when describing the act of drinking.
example: 彼女は水を飲みます。 (kanojo wa mizu o nomimasu) - She drinks water.

when_to_say: Used to describe hot weather or temperature.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。 (kyou wa totemo atsui desu) - Today is very hot.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather or temperature.
example: 冬は寒いです。 (fuyu wa samui desu) - Winter is cold.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or mental strength.
example: 彼は強い男です。 (kare wa tsuyoi otoko desu) - He is a strong man.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or mental weakness.
example: 彼女は少し弱いです。 (kanojo wa sukoshi yowai desu) - She is a bit weak.

when_to_say: Used to describe height.
example: この木はとても高いです。 (kono ki wa totemo takai desu) - This tree is very tall.

when_to_say: Used to express liking or preference.
example: 私は犬が好きです。 (watashi wa inu ga suki desu) - I like dogs.

when_to_say: Used to express dislike or aversion.
example: 私は猫が嫌いです。 (watashi wa neko ga kirai desu) - I dislike cats.

when_to_say: Used to describe something enjoyable.
example: その映画は楽しかったです。 (sono eiga wa tanoshikatta desu) - That movie was fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe sadness or sorrow.
example: 彼女は悲しそうです。 (kanojo wa kanashisou desu) - She looks sad.

when_to_say: Used to describe energy or enthusiasm.
example: 彼はいつも元気です。 (kare wa itsumo genki desu) - He is always energetic.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an inquiry or question.
example: 質問があります。 (shitsumon ga arimasu) - I have a question.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an answer or response.
example: 正しい答えを探してください。 (tadashii kotae o sagashite kudasai) - Please find the correct answer.

when_to_say: Used when describing forgetting something.
example: 宿題を忘れました。 (shukudai o wasuremashita) - I forgot my homework.

when_to_say: Used when describing remembering something.
example: その歌を覚えています。 (sono uta o oboeteimasu) - I remember that song.

when_to_say: Used to express knowing information.
example: 彼の名前を知っていますか？ (kare no namae o shitteimasu ka?) - Do you know his name?
